pr_title: Use SystemAccess to query JMX in health metrics

timeline.message: Use SystemAccess to query JMX in health metrics

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is necessary.
timeline.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText:
it's necessary to handle the case where we have CPU timers in place before we make JMX available - in such cases the cpu time will be negative while JMX is not yet ready (that's the current contract in the SystemAccess javadoc) and we won't bother aggregating it. As soon as JMX is up then we will aggregate CPU time.
This also matches how the profiler uses this method in ScopeEvent: 
  
    
      dd-trace-java/dd-trace-core/jfr-openjdk/src/main/java/datadog/trace/core/jfr/openjdk/ScopeEvent.java
    
    
         Line 52
      in
      e4331fb
